definition: to become or make something fixed and unable to change
to become or make something hard like bone
a disease caused by eating food that lacks certain nutrients (= substances important for health) that leads to problems with the skin, digestive system and brain
a way of connecting to the internet that allows you to receive information, including pictures, etc., very quickly and that is always active (so that the user does not have to connect each time)
signals that use a wide range of frequencies
the ability to control your thoughts and actions in order to achieve what you want to do
connected with society and the way it is organized
to include something in a particular group and not consider it separately
an idea or a plan of action that is suggested, especially in business
a thing that you intend to do; a problem, task or person to be dealt with
(in the US) a suggested change to the law that people can vote on
a statement that expresses an opinion
a statement of a theorem, and an explanation of how it can be proved
straight up or down from a level surface or from top to bottom in a picture, etc.
in a way that has top, middle and bottom levels
something that somebody has done or written that does not seem natural; the fact of seeming artificial
a clever or complicated device or tool made for a particular purpose
a clever plan or trick; the act of using a clever plan or trick
a thing that somebody does, or something that somebody says at the beginning of a situation or conversation, that is intended to give them some advantage
a move or moves made at the beginning of a game of chess in order to gain an advantage later
words or actions that are carefully planned to get an advantage over somebody else
a complicated series of connections between different things
showing you do not care or are not anxious about what you are doing
happy; not anxious
ordinary writing, not typed or written in shorthand
a unit for measuring the power of an engine
one of two metal bands joined by a chain, used for fastening a prisoner’s ankles or wrists together
a pair of metal rings joined by a chain, used for holding the wrists of a prisoner together
a type of fuel made from plant or animal material and used in diesel engines
a person or company that produces goods in large quantities
a large, strong dog with short hair
a person who has a million pounds, dollars, etc.; a very rich person
a ship used for finding and clearing away mines (= bombs that explode when they are touched)
relating to or connected with money
a person whose job is the care and treatment of the hands and nails
a secret organization of criminals, that is active especially in Sicily, Italy and the US
an organized group of criminals similar to the Mafia in the way it operates
a group of people within an organization or a community who use their power to get advantages for themselves
a person who works too hard and is considered boring
a person who takes a great deal of interest in the details of political policy
a person, especially a boy or a man, who does not have good social skills and is not fashionable
a short description of a book, a new product, etc., written by the people who have produced it, that is intended to attract your attention and make you want to buy it
designed to cause fires
causing strong feelings or violence
